tutorial.description: How to upload a model to the model database.

tutorial.description: Introduction to the series and basic concepts

tutorial.description: Get familiar with the source code and toolchain

tutorial.title: Ubuntu
tutorial.description: Installation instructions for Ubuntu using packages (amd64, i386 or armhf)

tutorial.title: Debian, Fedora, Arch or Gentoo
tutorial.description: Installation instructions for major linux distributions (non Ubuntu). Currently, Debian, Fedora, Arch Linux and Gentoo.

tutorial.title: Mac
tutorial.description: Installation instructions for Mac installations using homebrew

tutorial.title: Windows
tutorial.description: Installation instructions for Windows.

tutorial.title: Unstable packages: prerelease and nightly (Ubuntu)
tutorial.description: How to install and uninstall the unstable Ubuntu packages. Prereleases and nightly releases are designed for users who wants to contribute to gazebo developement or testing. Don't use them unless you have a good reason for it.

tutorial.title: From source (Ubuntu and Mac)
tutorial.description: Installation instructions for building a gazebo application using the source code. For user who want to contribute with code patches or pull requests.

tutorial.title: Dependencies from source
tutorial.description: Install some dependencies from source, such as SDFormat and Ignition libraries.

tutorial.title: Old versions (prior to gazebo4)
tutorial.description: Installation instructions for version prior to 4.0 of Gazebo

tutorial.title: Quick Start
tutorial.description: Simple and fast introduction to Gazebo.

tutorial.title: Plugins 101
tutorial.description: Overview of Gazebo plugins.

tutorial.title: Model plugins
tutorial.description: Manipulate a model using a model plugin.

tutorial.title: World plugins
tutorial.description: Inserting models using a world plugin.

tutorial.title: Programmatic World Control
tutorial.description: Modify world properties, such as ambient color and the physics time step.

tutorial.title: Make a Mobile Robot
tutorial.description: How to make a 2-wheeled mobile robot

tutorial.title: Import Meshes
tutorial.description: How to import 3D meshes into Gazebo for use as visual and collision entities

tutorial.title: Attach Meshes
tutorial.description: Improve model visual appearance by attaching Collada meshes

tutorial.description: Connect the simple gripper to the mobile robot

tutorial.title: Make a model
tutorial.description: Describes models, and how to create custom models.

tutorial.title: Make an animated model (actor)
tutorial.description: Describes how to create animated skeletons and scripted trajectories.

tutorial.title: Model structure and requirements
tutorial.description: Describes how Gazebo finds and load models, and requirements for creating a model.

tutorial.title: How to contribute a model
tutorial.description: Describes how add a new model to the Gazebo model database.

tutorial.description: Describes how to create an assembly of models.

tutorial.title: Camera Distortion
tutorial.description: How to add distortion to cameras.

tutorial.title: Create a Video with a Camera
tutorial.description: Shows how to create a video from a camera in the world.

tutorial.description: How to populate a simulated world with simulated objects.

tutorial.description: How to change scene and physics parameters of a world using the GUI.

tutorial.description: Learn how to control which geometries collide or do not collide with each other through the use of bitmasks.

tutorial.description: Fluid simulation on the GPU using Fluidix library.

tutorial.title: Aerodynamics
tutorial.description: Simulate aerodynamic robots and vehicles with the LiftDragPlugin.

tutorial.title: Hydrodynamics
tutorial.description: Simulate self-propelling underwater submarines using lift, drag, and buoyancy forces.

tutorial.description: Record and playback your simulation, via the GUI or command line.

tutorial.description: Introspect Gazebo and your plugins

tutorial.description: How to filter a recorded state log file.

tutorial.description: Use the graphical interface to apply force and torque to your models.

tutorial.description: How to dump simulation data into HDF5 format for benchmark.

tutorial.description: Overview of the basic components in a Gazebo simulation.

tutorial.description: How to apply lightmaps to a model visual.

tutorial.description: Describes the process of making a system plugin that is loaded by the GUI

tutorial.description: How to grasp and view the state while using the 3-Finger gripper grom RobotiQ

tutorial.description: Setup Gazebo to generate a stereo images suitable for use with stereo glasses.

tutorial.description: Miscellaneous Gazebo-ROS tricks and tips.

tutorial.description: How to add or modify tutorials.

tutorial.description: How to create new code for inclusion into Gazebo.

tutorial.description: Description of the Gazebo development process.

tutorial.title: Capture screenshot
tutorial.description: Shows how to capture a screen shot of Gazebo's render window.

tutorial.title: Player Position
tutorial.description: Covers connecting the position2d Player interface to Gazebo.

tutorial.title: Player Laser
tutorial.description: Covers connecting the laser Player interface to Gazebo.

tutorial.title: Player Camera
tutorial.description: Covers connecting the camera Player interface to Gazebo.

tutorial.title: Clone a simulation
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to clone the current simulation.

tutorial.title: BDI Atlas Robot Interface 3.0.0 Stand-In Example
tutorial.description: A guide to compiling a stand-in for the AtlasRobotInterface library version 3.0.0.

tutorial.title: Launchfile options
tutorial.description: A guide to launching DRCSim with different Atlas versions, hand options, and world files.

tutorial.title: Atlas fake walking
tutorial.description: How to drive a simulated Atlas as if it were a wheeled robot.

tutorial.title: Spawn Atlas into a custom world
tutorial.description: How to spawn Atlas into your own custom world.

tutorial.title: Modify environment
tutorial.description: How to modify the simulated Atlas' environment, such as adding objects to the world.

tutorial.title: DRC Simulator installation
tutorial.description: Explains how to install the DRC Simulator.

tutorial.title: Visualization and logging
tutorial.description: How to visualize and log sensor data.

tutorial.title: Atlas MultiSense SL head
tutorial.description: How to visualize data streams from the simulated Atlas robot Multisense SL head.

tutorial.title: Animate joints
tutorial.description: How to move a robot in simulation without dynamics through the use of a model plugin and ROS.

tutorial.title: Grasp with Sandia hands
tutorial.description: How to send desired grasp pose to Sandia hands mounted on the Atlas robot through ROS.

tutorial.title: Atlas Keyboard Teleoperation over ROS
tutorial.description: DRCSim provides an interface to the Atlas Sim Interface and BDI Controller. It consists of an Actionlib server and a keyboard_teleop python ROS node. This tutorial explains how to use the teleop.

tutorial.title: Atlas switching control modes
tutorial.description: How to use the BDI-provided behavior library to control the Atlas robot, and how to switch between behavior-library control and your own controller.

tutorial.title: How to use the Atlas Sim Interface
tutorial.description: How to use the Atlas Sim Interface to command Atlas to walk dynamically or step statically.

tutorial.title: Atlas Controller Synchronization over ROS Topics
tutorial.description: How to setup synchronized controller updates over ROS topics by using the built-in synchronization mechanism within Atlas simulation interface AtlasPlugin

tutorial.title: Atlas control over ROS with python
tutorial.description: How to control the Atlas robot with a python joint trajectory controller.

tutorial.title: Sending joint commands with ROS
tutorial.description: How to send joint positions to a robot in simulation through the use of a simple joint position command ROS topic publisher.

tutorial.title: DRC vehicle tele-operation
tutorial.description: How to control the DRC Vehicle using ROS topics provided by the VRC plugin.

tutorial.title: DRC vehicle tele-operation with Atlas
tutorial.description: How to automatically place the Atlas robot in the driver's seat of the DRC vehicle using ROS topics provided by the VRC plugin. Note that this is a development aid provided for testing.

tutorial.title: Changing Viscous Damping Coefficients Over ROS Service
tutorial.description: Changing Atlas and Sandia Hand Joint Viscous Damping Coefficients Over ROS Service

tutorial.title: Teleoperate atlas with a music mixer
tutorial.description: How to use a music mixer, to teleoperate the Atlas model.

tutorial.title: Running BDI controller demo
tutorial.description: How to start the 5-step behavior demo implemented in the Boston Dynamics Atlas Behavior library.

tutorial.title: GUI Overlay
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to create custom GUI interfaces for Gazebo.

tutorial.title: Setting Velocity on Joints and Links
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to programatically set velocities on links and joints

tutorial.title: GazeboJs installation
tutorial.description: Explains how to install the javascript NodeJs bindings to Gazebo.

tutorial.title: GazeboJs installation on Mac
tutorial.description: Explains how to install the javascript NodeJs bindings to Gazebo on OSX.

tutorial.title: GazeboJs publish and subscribe
tutorial.description: Explains how to write publishers and subscribers for Gazebo topics.

tutorial.title: GazeboJs camera topics
tutorial.description: Explains how to save images from Gazebo camera topics.

tutorial.title: GazeboJs models
tutorial.description: Explains how to access the sdf and to get other information from Gazebo models.

tutorial.title: GazeboJs hydra publisher
tutorial.description: Hydra publisher using node-sixense and GazeboJs

tutorial.title: HAPTIX environment setup
tutorial.description: Instructions for the hardware installation and desktop environment configuration of a HAPTIX simulation system. The HAPTIX simulation system is a specific hardware and software configuration designed by OSRF for teams participating in the HAPTIX program.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX C API
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to use the C API, defined at http://gazebosim.org/haptix/api and implemented in the haptix-comm package, for creating a hand controller.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX software install and update
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to install Gazebo and the HAPTIX client library, haptix-comm. Also included are instructions for updating software after it has been installed.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX Matlab and Octave API
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to use the Matlab/Octave interface for creating a hand controller. The Matlab/Octave interface is a wrapper around the C-API.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX Simulation World API
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to use the World API to manipulate the simulation state.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX Tactor Glove
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to craft a DIY tactor glove for experiencing simulated sensor data with real tactile feedback.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX Teleoperation
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to control arm position and grasps using a keyboard, SpaceNav, or Razer Hydra.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX Optitrack Control
tutorial.description: How to configure the Optitrack V120 Trio camera and the Motive motion tracking software to control the arm and viewpoint in Gazebo.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX Simulation World API with Custom World Example
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to use the World API to manipulate the simulation state in a custom world.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX logging
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to use the World API and the Gazebo GUI for creating and playing back a log file.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX DEKA Luke hand installation
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to install the DEKA Luke hand model and use it in Gazebo.

tutorial.title: HAPTIX Simulation Scoring Plugin Example
tutorial.description: This tutorial describes how to use the Gazebo SimEvents plugin to keep score of individual user task performance in a custom world.

category.title: Installation
category.description: Instructions to install Gazebo on all the plaforms supported: major linux distributions and Mac (windows is still under development).

category.title: Get Started
category.description: Welcome to the Gazebo tutorials! This is a great place to start, especially if you're a new Gazebo user. Each category to the left presents a collection of relevant tutorials.

category.title: Build a Robot
category.description: The following tutorials describe how to build and modify a robot. Included are examples of building a wheeled robot, attaching sensors, attaching actuators, and animating a model.

category.title: Model Editor
category.description: The following tutorials describe how to build and modify robots using the model editor.

category.title: Build a World
category.description: These tutorials describe how to create an environment in which robots can be simulated.

category.title: Tools and utilities
category.description: Gazebo ships with many tools and utilities. These tutorials describe the available tools, and how they are used.

category.title: Write a plugin
category.description: Plugins allow you to control models, sensors, world properties, and even the way Gazebo runs. The following tutorials describe how to create and load plugins for various purposes.

category.title: Plugins
category.description: The following tutorials describe how to use plugins that are available in Gazebo.

category.title: Sensors
category.description: A simulated sensor analyzes the environment and produces a data stream that closely matches the sensor's physical counterpart. These tutorials describe how to use and modify sensors.

category.title: Using Math
category.description: Gazebo has a custom math library. These tutorials describe how to use these math functions.

category.title: User input
category.description: User input can take many forms, including interactions from the graphical interface and hardware devices such as joysticks.

category.title: Connect to Player
category.description: Player is a robot control framework. These tutorials describe how to interface Gazebo and Player.

category.title: Web client (Gzweb)
category.description: Gzweb is a WebGL client for Gazebo. It lets you interact with the simulation from the comfort of a web browser.

category.title: Connect to ROS
category.description: ROS is a robot control framework. These tutorials describe how to interface Gazebo and ROS.

category.title: Transport Library
category.description: Communication between the simulation server and client tools uses an advanced message passing system. These tutorials describe how to use Gazebo's message passing infrastructure.

category.title: Physics Library
category.description: A core component of Gazebo are the physics engines. These tutorials describe how to use the physics engines in order to acheive desired behavior.

category.title: Rendering Library
category.description: Gazebo's rendering library is used to generate sensor data and provide user feedback by rendering the environment state.

category.title: Development
category.description: Customizing Gazebo is easy thanks to extensive documentation, tutorials, and online support. These tutorials describe how to contribute your modifications back to Gazebo.

category.title: DRCSim
category.description: DARPA Robotics Challenge specific tutorials.

category.title: Scripting (javascript and NodeJs)
category.description: Gazebo scripting interface: NodeJS bindings for the Gazebo simulator.

category.title: HAPTIX
category.description: The following are tutorials designed for HAPTIX, a DARPA program designed to develop new science and technology to achieve closed-loop control of dexterous mechatronic prosthesesis. For more information, please visit http://gazebosim.org/haptix.
